answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some articles and reports which you may find helpful.
This report from Eau Claire, Wisconsin discusses the difficulties involved in a shared services agreement.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1484/Shared_Services_Report
I have included at PowerPoint presentation on Conflict Resolution from this year’s conference.
http://webapps.icma.org/conference_Handouts/handouts2011/Conflict%20Resolution-Baldwin.pdf
This article describes important aspects of successful collaboration with private organizations.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3524/Collaboration_Calls_for_Mutual_Accountability
A similar article discusses the successful Project Coordination Program from Sarasota, Florida. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2102/Project_Coordination_Program
This PowerPoint presentation covers the "Texas Model" for Public-Private Partnerships, which emphasizes best practices for collaboration and goal-sharing.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302103/The_Texas_Model_for_PublicPrivate_Partnerships
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Lisa Callas
text:
Hello,
I am looking for examples of a conflict resolution process as it relates to service delivery by a shared/corporate services provider (ie: IT, HR, Materials Management, etc). I'm hoping that this might be incorporated into an SLA or governance model document.
title: Conflict Resolution Process
